definition: Li Gongpu (-1946), communist killed by Guomindang in Kunming in 1946

surname Li

Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
Zou Taofen (1895-1944), journalist, political theorist and publisher
Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Shao Piaoping (1884-1926), pioneer of journalism and founder of newspaper Beijing Press 京報|京报, executed in 1926 by warlord Zhang Zuolin 張作霖|张作霖
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
Liao Mosha (1907-1990), journalist and communist propagandist, severely criticized and imprisoned for 10 years during the Cultural Revolution
Zhang Tailei (1898-1927), founding member of Chinese communist party
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
Song Jiaoren (1882-1913), politician of the revolutionary party involved in the 1911 Xinhai revolution, murdered in Shanghai in 1913
Chen Tianhua (1875-1905), anti-Qing revolutionary from Hunan, drowned himself in Japan in 1905
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
